00045 typedef unsigned long long rthal_time_t;

00047 #define __rthal_u64tou32(ull, h, l) ({                  \
00048         union { unsigned long long _ull;                \
00049             struct { u_long _h; u_long _l; } _s; } _u;  \
00050         _u._ull = (ull);                                \
00051         (h) = _u._s._h;                                 \
00052         (l) = _u._s._l;                                 \
00053         })
00054 
00055 #define __rthal_u64fromu32(h, l) ({                     \
00056         union { unsigned long long _ull;                \
00057             struct { u_long _h; u_long _l; } _s; } _u;  \
00058         _u._s._h = (h);                                 \
00059         _u._s._l = (l);                                 \
00060         _u._ull;                                        \
00061         })
00062 
00063 static inline unsigned long long rthal_ullmul(const unsigned long m0, 
00064                                               const unsigned long m1)
00065 {
00066     return (unsigned long long) m0 * m1;
00067 }
00068 
00069 static inline unsigned long long rthal_ulldiv (unsigned long long ull,
00070                                                const unsigned long uld,
00071                                                unsigned long *const rp)
00072 {
00073 #if defined(__KERNEL__) && BITS_PER_LONG == 32
00074     const unsigned long r = __div64_32(&ull, uld);
00075 #else /* !__KERNEL__ || BITS_PER_LONG == 64 */
00076     const unsigned long r = ull % uld;
00077     ull /= uld;
00078 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */
00079 
00080     if (rp)
00081         *rp = r;
00082 
00083     return ull;
00084 }
00085 
00086 #define rthal_uldivrem(ull,ul,rp) ((u_long) rthal_ulldiv((ull),(ul),(rp)))
00087 
00088 static inline int rthal_imuldiv (int i, int mult, int div) {
00089 
00090     /* Returns (int)i = (unsigned long long)i*(u_long)(mult)/(u_long)div. */
00091     const unsigned long long ull = rthal_ullmul(i, mult);
00092     return rthal_uldivrem(ull, div, NULL);
00093 }
00094 
00095 static inline __attribute_const__
00096 unsigned long long __rthal_ullimd (const unsigned long long op,
00097                                    const unsigned long m,
00098                                    const unsigned long d)
00099 {
00100     u_long oph, opl, tlh, tll, qh, rh, ql;
00101     unsigned long long th, tl;
00102 
00103     __rthal_u64tou32(op, oph, opl);
00104     tl = rthal_ullmul(opl, m);
00105     __rthal_u64tou32(tl, tlh, tll);
00106     th = rthal_ullmul(oph, m);
00107     th += tlh;
00108 
00109     qh = rthal_uldivrem(th, d, &rh);
00110     th = __rthal_u64fromu32(rh, tll);
00111     ql = rthal_uldivrem(th, d, NULL);
00112     return __rthal_u64fromu32(qh, ql);
00113 }
00114 
00115 static inline long long rthal_llimd (long long op,
00116                                      unsigned long m,
00117                                      unsigned long d)
00118 {
00119 
00120     if(op < 0LL)
00121         return -__rthal_ullimd(-op, m, d);
00122     return __rthal_ullimd(op, m, d);
00123 }

00125 static inline unsigned long ffnz (unsigned long ul) {
00126 
00127     __asm__ __volatile__ ("cntlzw %0, %1" : "=r" (ul) : "r" (ul & (-ul)));
00128     return 31 - ul;
00129 }

00169 #define rthal_cli()                     adeos_stall_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain)
00170 #define rthal_sti()                     adeos_unstall_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain)
00171 #define rthal_local_irq_save(x)         ((x) = !!adeos_test_and_stall_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain))
00172 #define rthal_local_irq_restore(x)      adeos_restore_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain,(x))
00173 #define rthal_local_irq_flags(x)        ((x) = !!adeos_test_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain))
00174 #define rthal_local_irq_test()          (!!adeos_test_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain))
00175 #define rthal_local_irq_sync(x)         ((x) = !!adeos_test_and_unstall_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain))

00191 static inline void rthal_spin_lock_irq(spinlock_t *lock) {
00192 
00193     rthal_cli();
00194     rthal_spin_lock(lock);
00195 }
00196 
00197 static inline void rthal_spin_unlock_irq(spinlock_t *lock) {
00198 
00199     rthal_spin_unlock(lock);
00200     rthal_sti();
00201 }

00203 static inline unsigned long rthal_spin_lock_irqsave(spinlock_t *lock) {
00204 
00205     unsigned long flags;
00206     rthal_local_irq_save(flags);
00207     rthal_spin_lock(lock);
00208     return flags;
00209 }
00210 
00211 static inline void rthal_spin_unlock_irqrestore(unsigned long flags,
00212                                                 spinlock_t *lock) {
00213     rthal_spin_unlock(lock);
00214     rthal_local_irq_restore(flags);
00215 }

00217 #if !defined(CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS)
00218 
00219 /* Since real-time interrupt handlers are called on behalf of the RTAI
00220    domain stack, we cannot infere the "current" Linux task address
00221    using %esp. We must use the suspended Linux domain's stack pointer
00222    instead. */
00223 
00224 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_get_root_current (int cpuid) {
00225     return ((struct thread_info *)(adp_root->esp[cpuid] & (~8191UL)))->task;
00226 }
00227 
00228 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_get_current (int cpuid)
00229 
00230 {
00231     register unsigned long esp asm ("r1");
00232     /* FIXME: r2 should be ok or even __adeos_current_threadinfo() - offsetof(THREAD) */
00233     
00234     if (esp >= rthal_domain.estackbase[cpuid] && esp < rthal_domain.estackbase[cpuid] + 8192)
00235         return rthal_get_root_current(cpuid);
00236 
00237     return current;
00238 }
00239 
00240 #else /* CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS */
00241 
00242 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_get_root_current (int cpuid) {
00243     return current;
00244 }
00245 
00246 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_get_current (int cpuid) {
00247     return current;
00248 }
00249 
00250 #endif /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS */

00252 static inline void rthal_set_timer_shot (unsigned long delay) {
00253 
00254     if (delay) {
00255 #ifdef CONFIG_40x
00256         mtspr(SPRN_PIT,delay);
00257 #else /* !CONFIG_40x */
00258         set_dec(delay);
00259 #endif /* CONFIG_40x */
00260     }
00261 }

00280 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00281 
00282 typedef struct rthal_fpenv {
00283     
00284     /* This layout must follow exactely the definition of the FPU
00285        backup area in a PPC thread struct available from
00286        <asm-ppc/processor.h>. Specifically, fpr[] an fpscr words must
00287        be contiguous in memory (see arch/ppc/hal/fpu.S). */
00288 
00289     double fpr[32];
00290     unsigned long fpscr_pad;    /* <= Hi-word of the FPR used to */
00291     unsigned long fpscr;        /* retrieve the FPSCR. */
00292 
00293 } rthal_fpenv_t;
00294 
00295 void rthal_init_fpu(rthal_fpenv_t *fpuenv);
00296 
00297 void rthal_save_fpu(rthal_fpenv_t *fpuenv);
00298 
00299 void rthal_restore_fpu(rthal_fpenv_t *fpuenv);

00301 #ifndef CONFIG_SMP
00302 #define rthal_get_fpu_owner(cur) last_task_used_math
00303 #else /* CONFIG_SMP */
00304 #define rthal_get_fpu_owner(cur) ({                             \
00305     struct task_struct * _cur = (cur);                          \
00306     ((_cur->thread.regs && (_cur->thread.regs->msr & MSR_FP))   \
00307      ? _cur : NULL);                                            \
00308 })
00309 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00310     
00311 #define rthal_disable_fpu() ({                          \
00312     register long msr;                                  \
00313     __asm__ __volatile__ ( "mfmsr %0" : "=r"(msr) );    \
00314     __asm__ __volatile__ ( "mtmsr %0"                   \
00315                            : /* no output */            \
00316                            : "r"(msr & ~(MSR_FP))       \
00317                            : "memory" );                \
00318 })
00319 
00320 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
